Articles.Content: Hey, every space program needs a simulated low-gravity environment, like the Vomit Comet. Here's the Kerbal equivalent, the Purge Scourge. 5 Hi-Performance Engines will rocket you up into the stratosphere, where you will reach a service ceiling of 16,500-17,000 metres. In an emergency due to low fuel levels, this craft can glide to safety, down to a gentle 47.5 m/s to guarantee a soft landing. I managed to get this craft to 20,025 metres for a height record (not sustained flight) and afterwards when it descended, its speed reached about 706.5 m/s (just over Mach 2). Happy Flying!
so... the low drag in the stratosphere simulate low grav. Genius!
Thanks, Pelican. I tried my best to make a backswept wing to further reduce drag, but at the same time, provide excellent air grip.
Also, just set a new height record for this plane. Height to beat is 26,735 metres. That's almost the equivalent of 88,000 feet!
